Replying to @thescottsb 2019-07-16 11:27
@thescottsb @VeryThorough @Netlify For sure. Both avenues are available so you have the option of first seeking help from a larger pool of folks, but also have the email option too. Response times are just difficult to assure on the free/starter tier. The community scales much better and eases pressure on email.

Replying to @thescottsb 2019-07-15 21:54
@thescottsb @Netlify I think the spirit of that is about the level of service and response time commitments rather suggesting that all emails will be ignored unless you're on an enterprise tier. Lots of free email support happens. But thanks for the feedback on this wording. I'll share internally.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @thescottsb 2019-07-15 21:33
@thescottsb @Netlify No. Email support is still available to all. But the queue prioritisation is influenced by the level of support paid for. The support team also hang out in https://t.co/V3TBEBCuku to expedite lots of common requests and help people help each other, so it's well worth a look.
